back: Modulation is changing a wave (carrier) so it can carry data, like voice or internet signals.
A high-frequency wave that is changed (modulated) to carry information.
The original data (like audio or digital bits) that changes the carrier wave.
The height of the carrier wave (amplitude) changes based on the data.
The closeness of the wave peaks (frequency) changes based on the data.

front: Why are twisted pair cables twisted?
back: Twisting cancels out electromagnetic noise to keep the signal clear.
Unshielded Twisted Pair – a common cable type with no extra shielding.

front: How is Cat5e better than Cat5?
back: Cat5e has tighter specs to reduce crosstalk and supports faster speeds (up to 1 Gbps).
The point in a filter where it starts reducing unwanted frequencies.
Quadrature Amplitude Modulation – sends data by changing both amplitude (height) and phase (timing) of a wave.
